newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: SIMEX Euroyen, JGB futures pare gains on yen.
newsitem.headline: SIMEX Euroyen, JGB futures pare gains on yen.

text.p: SIMEX Euroyen and Japanese government bond (JGB) futures pared gains late on Friday after the yen retreated from initial highs, dealers said.
A slew of pro-yen comments from Japanese and U.S. officials helped Euroyen futures breach important resistance levels.

"Supportive comments from government officials led the yen higher," a U.S. commission house dealer said. But the early speculative sales of dollars cooled, resulting in a pullback in the yen, which spilled into euroyen and JGB's.
December Euroyen stood at 99.05 at 1120 GMT against its IMM close of 99.05, but off intraday highs of 99.08.
June JGBs settled at 126.66 against their open at 127.00, on a low volume of 207.
Dealers said conflicting comments by key finance officials, and concern central banks may intervene in the market, acted to keep the market nervous and mostly sidelined.
"Interest rate markets and currency futures are very nervous at this time. It's the speed at which the dollar is rising," a European commission house dealer said.
Eurodollar futures drifted sideways in lacklustre conditions awaiting U.S. inflation data on Friday, which could sway the current outlook for higher interest rates.
U.S. Producer Price Index (PPI) and retail sales data for March will both be released on Friday.
Analysts expect little surprise from the PPI figures but a poll in the U.S. by Reuters forecast retail sales to have risen 0.6 percent in March and 0.4 percent, excluding car sales.
Dealers said strong economic growth pointed to a further hike in interest rates by 25 basis points at the next Federal Open Market Committee meeting on May 20.
September Eurodollars ended at 93.730 against their IMM close at 93.73 on moderate volume of 7300 lots.
